metadata.title: CVE-2023-27522 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
HTTP Response Smuggling vulnerability in Apache HTTP Server viamod_proxy_uwsgi. This issue affects Apache HTTP Server: from 2.4.30 through2.4.55. Special characters in the origin response header can truncate/splitthe response forwarded to the client.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-27522` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.52-1ubuntu4.4
apache2-bin - 2.4.52-1ubuntu4.4
apache2-data - 2.4.52-1ubuntu4.4
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.52-1ubuntu4.4
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.52-1ubuntu4.4
apache2-utils - 2.4.52-1ubuntu4.4
libapache2-mod-md - 2.4.52-1ubuntu4.4
libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi - 2.4.52-1ubuntu4.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.52-1ubuntu4.4').
